node.title: Woman Who Says She Was Trafficked to Prince Andrew Not Part of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
node.description: Virginia Giuffre claimed she was forced to have sexual encounters with billionaires, politicians, royals and heads of state because of Ghislaine Maxwell.

node.title: Ajaz Patel excited to play in his country of birth
node.description: Black Caps spinner Ajaz Patel says he wants to make the most of playing in India for the first time.

node.title: Over 100 nurses sacked after refusing vaccine
node.description: Just over 100 nurses, 14 midwives and 10 doctors have been sacked from District Health Boards for refusing to be vaccinated against Covid-19.

node.title: Thanksgiving in a Town Built on Lederhosen and Limitless Meals
node.description: Bavarian charm, Christmas knickknacks and all-you-can-eat restaurants draw hordes every holiday season to the twinkly streets of Frankenmuth, Mich.

node.title: Pakistan, Stricken by Surging Inflation, Seeks an I.M.F. Lifeline
node.description: Rising prices and a weakened currency are straining households, intensifying pressure on Prime Minister Imran Khan to find solutions.

node.title: Four Asteroids to Zip Past Earth on Thanksgiving, With One Bigger Than a Football Field
node.description: The largest asteroid will speed past Earth at 42,000 miles per hour, over 689 times as fast as a Tom Brady throw.

node.title: Unconscious Mom Saved by Heroic 3-Year-Old Who Learned to Call Police From Cartoon
node.description: "I want people to know what my son did and how important it is to [teach] kids what to do if anything happens in an emergency," said the toddler's mom.

node.title: Refugee Says Police Called Migrants 'Animals,' Stole Money During Attempted EU Crossing
node.description: Ibrahim Rasool said in an interview with the Associated Press that he wants to return to living a normal life, "it doesn't matter which country."

node.title: Unvaccinated Man Relearning to Walk After COVID Complications, Urges Others Get Shot
node.description: Justin Moon, a former University of Alabama football player, was hospitalized with COVID-19 and was legally dead for four minutes.

node.title: Woman Shot, Killed After Aiming Gun at Biker She Intentionally Hit With Her Car: Police
node.description: The motorcyclist shot the 35-year-old librarian after following her home, where she pointed a gun at him.

node.title: Mother Dies After Being Sent to Surgical Recovery Center Following Brazilian Butt Lift
node.description: "Rachelle was 32. She had two small children and that's the last thing she said to me. 'Tell my boys I love them,'" the victim's friend told local media.

node.title: Bald Eagle Steals Shark From Fisherman's Line in Wild Video
node.description: "The way everything lined up, the sunset; I couldn't have asked for a better time," fisherman Chad Rissman said.

node.title: Club behind Team New Zealand gets venue petition
node.description: The Royal New Zealand Yacht Squadron is being asked to take another look at Auckland as an option for the 37th America's Cup.

node.title: No one missing out on MIQ after Air NZ cancels 1000 flights - Foran
node.description: No one is losing their MIQ bookings after Air New Zealand cancelled 1000 flights yesterday, the airline's CEO says. Audio

node.title: Covid-19: Vaccine passes raise more questions than answers for businesses
node.description: Businesses will throw open their doors to customers under the new traffic light framework next Friday, but as the nuts and bolts are being worked through there seem to be more questions than answers.

node.title: U.S. adds Germany and Denmark to "do not travel" list
node.description: The European region as a whole has seen an uptick in COVID-19 cases. Austria even imposed a new lockdown and nationwide vaccine mandate.

node.title: Review: A Tale of Two Hawkeyes
node.description: Disney+’s new Marvel series, “Hawkeye,” finally gives Jeremy Renner a headlining role — as mentor and straight man.

node.title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
node.description: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

node.title: N.Y.U. Skirball Season Reinvigorates the Classics
node.description: Elevator Repair Service will premiere a show inspired by Chekhov’s “The Seagull,” and the Classical Theater of Harlem’s hip-hop-infused “Seize the King” gets an encore.

node.title: Contending with the Pandemic, Wealthy Nations Wage Global Battle for Migrants
node.description: Covid kept many people in place. Now several developed countries, facing aging labor forces and worker shortages, are racing to recruit, train and integrate foreigners.

node.title: Poland Warns Belarus Sending Migrants Back to Home Countries Doesn't Mean Crisis is Over
node.description: "These signals do not prove a change or a backing away from the strategic plans of the Lukashenko regime," the spokesman for Poland's security services said.

node.title: WHO Europe Calls for COVID Booster Shots for Vulnerable, Splitting With Organization's HQ
node.description: "We face a challenging winter ahead," WHO Europe Director Dr. Hans Kluge said in a statement.

node.title: French PM Stirs Ire as Maskless Video of Him at Event Circulates After Positive COVID Test
node.description: French Prime Minister Jean Castex tested positive for COVID-19 and faced scrutiny on social media after a video of him maskless and shaking hands at an event.

node.title: China Puts the Squeeze on Celebrities With Blacklist Governing Morals
node.description: Chinese government agencies have linked new regulations to attempts to clamp down on socially disruptive fan culture.

node.title: 12 Children Among 45 Killed in Bus Crash, Investigation Underway as to Accident's Cause
node.description: "The picture is horrifying, the people who were on the bus are turned to charcoal," Bulgarian Interior Minister Boyko Rashkov said at the crash site.

node.title: YouTube Takes Down Accounts Linked to Waukesha Parade Attack Suspect Darrell Brooks
node.description: Police say Darrell Brooks was behind the wheel of an SUV that drove through a Christmas parade, killing five and injuring 48 others.

node.title: Americans Advised to Avoid Germany Travel, Nation Weighs Vaccine Mandate Amid COVID Spike
node.description: "By the end of this winter pretty much everyone in Germany...will have been vaccinated, recovered or died," health minister Jens Spahn said Monday.

node.title: What Became of the Jan. 6 Rioters Whose Photos Went Viral
node.description: We look at some of the more prominent defendants whose images were captured during the Capitol attack.

node.title: Hospitals in These States Are Running Out of ICU Beds Amid Another COVID Surge
node.description: "The data show that the cases are starting to go up, which is not unexpected when you get into a winter season," Dr. Anthony Fauci said on Sunday.

node.title: Arbery's mom speaks out after attorney's "dirty toenails" comment
node.description: "I'll just say this, regardless of how long and how dirty his toenails were, that's still my son, and he didn't deserve to die the way that he died," Wanda Cooper-Jones told "CBS Mornings."

node.title: Regardless of the verdict, the Arbery murder suspects still face federal hate-crime charges.
node.description: The suspects were each charged by the Justice Department with interfering with Ahmaud Arbery’s right to use a public street because of his race, and with attempted kidnapping.

node.title: U.S. gunmakers ask court to dismiss Mexico's lawsuit over trafficking
node.description: The Mexican government says about 70% of the firearms trafficked to Mexico come from the U.S. – guns that were used in 17,000 murders in 2019 alone.

node.title: Jeff Goldblum Goes Wild With Wes Anderson and Thelonious Monk
node.description: The actor talks about the second season of “The World According to Jeff Goldblum” and why weeping over “Can’t Find My Way Home” is a beautiful thing.

node.title: Donald Trump Beats Joe Biden in Key Swing States in 2024 Matchup, New Poll Shows
node.description: The new findings showing the former president's edge in a hypothetical 2024 contest come as Joe Biden's own approval rating plummets.

node.title: Teacher Adopts Student That Has Spent Half Her Life in Foster Care: 'Completes Our Family'
node.description: Loralie, 9, is set to spend her first Thanksgiving as a member of the Henry family, after being adopted on Los Angeles' National Adoption Day.

node.title: Twenty-year-old former Hong Kong independence leader gets more than three years jail for secession
node.description: Tony Chung was an independence leader in Hong Kong who now at 20 years of age will spend more than three years in prison under the national security law.

node.title: A judge has dismissed criminal charges in an outbreak at a home for veterans in Massachusetts.
node.description: The judge wrote that two former administrators at the Soldiers’ Home in Holyoke, Mass., could not be held legally responsible because the veterans in the case had been exposed before two units at the home were merged.

node.title: China Backs Down in South China Sea After U.S., Philippines Warnings
node.description: Philippine Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said China promised not to intervene in its resupply missions to Second Thomas Shoal—part of a disputed archipelago.

node.title: Full List of Those Subpoenaed by January 6 Committee Over U.S. Capitol Riot
node.description: More than three dozen people have been subpoenaed by the January 6 committee.

node.title: Judge Timothy Walmsley of Savannah is presiding over the high-profile trial.
node.description: The judge was tapped to preside over the Ahmaud Arbery case in 2020 after all five judges in Glynn County, Ga., where the shooting occurred, recused themselves.

node.title: How Does Herpes Spread? New Mothers Who Died of Virus May Have Caught It From Same Surgeon
node.description: Both mothers died as a result of herpes infections after receiving cesarean sections at different hospitals.

node.title: Kashmiri Activist Arrested Under India’s Antiterrorism Act
node.description: Khurram Parvez’s detention has deepened concerns that the Modi administration is abusing the law to squelch dissent.

node.title: Alan Shepard's daughter and GMA's Michael Strahan to fly in space
node.description: The New Shepard flight in December will be Blue Origin's third with passengers and its first with a crew of six.

node.title: Holiday parade crash suspect has history of violence, records show
node.description: Darrell Brooks has been charged with crimes 16 times since 1999, according to court documents.

node.title: College student urges U.S. to also grant his Afghan family refuge
node.description: Countless Afghans with U.S. ties who were not evacuated are stranded in Afghanistan or neighboring countries desperately looking for a way to be resettled in America.

node.title: Revitalizing Black Neighborhoods by Preserving Their History
node.description: Developers are repurposing deteriorated structures in historically significant areas in an effort to incorporate spaces for the arts, affordable housing and small businesses under one roof.

node.title: What Will the Giants Do With Daniel Jones?
node.description: The Giants must evaluate their third-year quarterback ahead of a contract decision. Injuries to teammates, penalties and coaching decisions have made the assessment difficult.

node.title: Open or closed on Thanksgiving? Here are stores’ plans for Thursday and Friday.
node.description: Many retailers will close their stores on Thanksgiving Day, citing safety concerns and gratitude for their employees.

node.title: Biden’s Low-Key Media Strategy Draws Allies’ Concern
node.description: So far in his tenure, the president has given far fewer one-on-one interviews than his two predecessors. Some Democrats are asking if he could be making better use of his White House pulpit.

node.title: Former South Korean military dictator Chun Doo-hwan dies at 90
node.description: The office of South Korean President Moon Jae-in offers condolences but expresses regret over Chun Doo-hwan's failure to reveal the truth of the coup he led or apologise for it.

node.title: Republican Congressman Louie Gohmert launches bid for Texas attorney general
node.description: Gohmert joins a crowded field of Republicans looking to unseat incumbent Ken Paxton.

node.title: Ethiopia PM offers martyrdom on "battlefront" as war escalates
node.description: Talk of "martyrdom" being needed to defend his government - as he balks at international peace efforts - have surprised many coming from Nobel Peace Prize winner Abiy Ahmed.

node.title: A Chandelier Fit for a Disco
node.description: To create this fixture, the artist and designer Bethan Laura Wood mixed painted metal and PVC to kaleidoscopic effect.

node.title: The Nets Are Winning, but They Still Have a Lot to Figure Out
node.description: They’re winning when they should but struggling against teams they’ll probably see in the playoffs. They miss Kyrie Irving, but that doesn’t explain everything.

node.title: Another Thanksgiving. Another Crab Season Delay.
node.description: Fishermen in the Bay Area and other parts of California are grappling with an ever-shortening crab season.

node.title: Italy Frees Convicted Killer of U.K. Student Meredith Kercher
node.description: Rudy Guede had served 13 years of a 16-year sentence for the 2007 murder. Another student, Amanda Knox, was eventually exonerated in what became a polarizing case.

node.title: Mystery as Mammoth Tusk Discovered 10,000ft Below Pacific Ocean, Far From California Coast
node.description: The ancient tusk belongs to a Columbian mammoth, a species that became extinct about 10,000 years ago.

node.title: NASA Confirms Existence of Hundreds of New Worlds Outside Our Solar System
node.description: The space agency used a supercomputer program to confirm 301 suspected new planets, bringing the total to nearly 5,000.

node.title: Thousands of Low-Income Families to Get $1,800 Per Child Tax Credits Next Month
node.description: Low-income families who signed up for the credits before the deadline will get six months of the payments on December 15, the Internal Revenue Service said.

node.title: Federal government announces new commission for family, domestic and sexual violence prevention
node.description: A Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commission will be established by the Federal government to ensure "real and tangible" improvements are achieved under the next National Plan to end violence against women and children.

node.title: Malikah Shabazz, daughter of Malcolm X, found dead, NYPD says
node.description: Police say her death isn't considered suspicious at this point. She was 56.

node.title: Police say suspect intentionally plowed SUV into Wisconsin holiday parade
node.description: The suspect was being charged with five counts of first-degree intentional homicide. The five people killed at the parade ranged in age from 52 to 81.

node.title: Closing arguments in Ahmaud Arbery's killing focus on self-defense claims
node.description: Three White men are charged with murder for shooting a 25-year-old Black man who was jogging in the neighborhood.

node.title: Biden announces U.S. will release oil from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve
node.description: The administration has been pushing China, India, Japan and South Korea to join in a coordinated effort to release reserves of crude oil to help tamp down rising gasoline prices.

node.title: Prosecutors make final rebuttal in trial for Ahmaud Arbery's killing
node.description: The final rebuttal comes after both the prosecution and the defense delivered their closing arguments on Monday.

node.title: Clearview AI does well in another round of facial recognition accuracy tests.
node.description: This time, a federal agency assessed the ability to pick the right person out of millions of photos. Clearview’s app still faces legal hurdles.

node.title: President Biden will tap into U.S. oil reserves in concert with other nations.
node.description: To reduce global energy prices, the White House will release 50 million barrels of crude oil along with Britain, China, India, Japan and South Korea.

node.title: What We Know and Don’t Know About the Wisconsin Parade Attack
node.description: The suspect’s motivations are unclear in a tragedy that left five people dead and dozens more injured during a Christmas parade in Waukesha.

node.title: How Earth Might Be Saved if an Asteroid Was Headed Straight for Us
node.description: NASA's upcoming DART mission plans to hit an asteroid with a spacecraft to test Earth's defenses. But our chances of deflecting an asteroid depends on how much warning time we have.

node.title: You Can Now Get Paid $2,500 to Watch Your Favorite Christmas Movies
node.description: Reviews.org is looking for a Chief Holiday Cheermeister to simply review a selection of 25 holiday movies in 25 days for a generous sum of money.

node.title: RNC Paying Donald Trump's Legal Bills Reveals GOP Remains Hitched to Former President
node.description: The RNC called Trump "a leader of our party" and said that defending him was "critical to the GOP."

node.title: Members of "Dancing Grannies" among those killed in Wisconsin parade
node.description: The group said the members who died "were the glue" that "held us together."

node.title: ‘Boiling Point’ Review: The Worst Night in the Life of a Restaurant
node.description: Stephen Graham scowls and swears his way through a night of bad service in this single-shot drama set in London.

node.title: Hayao Miyazaki Prepares to Cast One Last Spell
node.description: No artist has explored the contradictions of humanity as sympathetically and critically as the Japanese animation legend. Now, at 80, he’s coming out of retirement with another movie.

node.title: Donald Trump Hosting $1K Per Person Mar-a-Lago Fundraiser for Florida Candidate
node.description: Anna Paulina Luna, who was endorsed by Trump in September, is currently leading in the polls in the race for Florida's 13th District.

node.title: AFL warns players they face 'trouble' over head knocks
node.description: Incoming AFL football operations boss Brad Scott vows not to introduce major changes next season, but will he seek to clear up rules around head contact?

node.title: Sri Lankan navy calls off search for missing people after ferry capsizes, killing at least six
node.description: Angry residents burned tyres and surrounded government offices, blaming officials for the the capsizing of a ferry that killed at least four children.

node.title: Dani Laidley returning to North Melbourne 'just being herself is a very, very positive sign'
node.description: Transgender advocates say Dani Laidley's return to Arden Street last week was an important step in recognising the trans community and showing how important a support network is in making people feel comfortable in their own skin.

node.title: Australia Might Genetically Modify Feral Cats Out of Existence
node.description: Report highlights the dire need to control its feral cat population and protect native wildlife.

node.title: Who is Chrystul Kizer? Black Woman's Case Under Spotlight After Kyle Rittenhouse Acquittal
node.description: Chrystul Kizer was 17 when she was charged in the killing of a man in Kenosha, Wisconsin, who was under investigation for child sex trafficking.

node.title: Parkland massacre families to get millions from DOJ over FBI inaction
node.description: Sixteen of 17 families of students killed settle lawsuit for $125 million-$130 million, sources say. The FBI didn't act on a tip saying Nikolas Cruz was going to shoot up a school.

node.title: The Latest Covid Surge
node.description: And how to make sense of it.

node.title: NASA probe set for historic asteroid deflection test
node.description: The $330 million DART probe will crash head-on into a small asteroid to test the possibility of averting future threats to Earth.

node.title: Senate Republicans hold fundraising edge over Democrats
node.description: But there is some good news for the Democratic Party —  its candidates have been outraising Republicans in key battleground races.

node.title: Watch Live As NASA Launches DART Mission to Smash Into Asteroid
node.description: The spacecraft will launch on Wednesday before hurtling into a space rock at 15,000 miles per hour in 2022 to test Earth's asteroid defences.

node.title: China's Peng Shuai Faces Uncertain Future Unless She Reverses Allegations
node.description: Uncertainty continues to surround the physical and psychological well-being of Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai as her #MeToo allegations are muted by Beijing.

node.title: 'Selling Sunset': How to Become A Real Estate Agent in Los Angeles
node.description: Netflix's "Selling Sunset" is set to return next month. If it makes you want to change career and sell luxury homes in California, here's how you can.

node.title: Alex Jones Says January 6 Committee 'Worse' Than McCarthyism Following Subpoena
node.description: The House select committee investigating the January 6 riot included the conspiracy theorist in a the latest round of subpoenas issued on Monday.

node.title: Venomous Snake Found Hiding Under Child's Bed Where Girl Was Sleeping
node.description: A video has shown the snake being captured after a family found it curled up under their daughter's bed.

node.title: Waukesha residents pack park for vigil for parade victims
node.description: "Our presence says that we, as a community, will work together to help all heal," Mayor Shawn Reilly said.

node.title: The Design Legacy of Covid? It’s All Around You.
node.description: Some objects and practices born in lockdown will probably stick around for decades — for better or worse.

node.title: How to Stand Correctly
node.description: Advice from the director of the Iyengar Yoga Institute of New York.

node.title: What Should I Do With My Big Fat Inheritance?
node.description: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on the burdens of philanthropy — and more.

node.title: How Alienation Became My Superpower
node.description: Feeling like an outsider can be painful. But it comes with secret gifts of perception.

node.title: A ‘Plant-Based’ Gift Guide
node.description: Twenty-seven ideas to satisfy tastes both garden variety and eccentric.

node.title: To Grandmother’s House, or Not. The Thanksgiving Travel Equation Is Tough to Solve.
node.description: The number of travelers this holiday weekend is expected to be close to prepandemic levels. But those numbers hide the kinds of decisions that families are making about how and where to gather. Here’s how six families are celebrating.

node.title: Why an NPR Quiz Show Panelist Loves Her ‘Messy Apartment’
node.description: Faith Salie, known for, among other things, her role on ‘Wait, Wait … Don’t Tell Me!,’ is ‘evangelical about the Upper West Side.’

node.description: James Shapiro reviews Lena Cowen Orlin’s book, which focuses on Shakespeare’s life in Stratford.

node.title: The San Francisco Homeless Crisis: What Has Gone Wrong?
node.description: Michael Shellenberger’s “San Fransicko” raises important questions about homelessness in San Francisco, but his answers are mired in controversy.

node.title: Warriors of History and Legend
node.description: Three new books examine the truths and myths surrounding the Spartans, the Vikings and the Spanish conquistadors.
